data.title: OBITUARIES
data.meta_description: ADAMS, Annabelle 90, Spring Hill, died March 19. Survived by daughter Joyce Buscemi, private services, March 25; burial Florida Nat'l. Brewer & Sons 352-688-4994
data.text:
ADAMS, Annabelle 90, Spring Hill, died March 19. Survived by daughter Joyce Buscemi, private services, March 25; burial Florida Nat'l. Brewer & Sons 352-688-4994

ARNETT, Shirley died, March 18, 2011. A Memorial Service will take place on March 25, 11 am at: Pinecrest Funeral Chapel www.pinecrestfuneralchapel.com

BALDERSON, Elizabeth M. 78, of Spring Hill, passed away on March 19, 2011. She was born in Orange, NJ and worked as an office administrator before retiring. She was very devoted to her family and a Presbyterian by faith. Surviving her are her children, Dale (husband, Carl) Milano, Bill (wife, Angie) Balderson and Barry (wife, Dawn) Balderson; grandchildren, Carl Jr., Lawrence, Adam, Kayleigh, Jessica, James, Chelsea, Cory and Sean; great-grand children, Leslie, Nathan and Dayton; and her sister, Nancy (husband, Gary) Sartor. Visitation will be from 5 to 8 pm on Wednesday, March 23rd and funeral service on Thursday at 11 am at Turner Funeral Home, 14360 Spring Hill Drive, 352-796-9661 turnerfuneralandcremation.com

BAMBREY, Hilda 85, died March 21, 2011 in New Port Richey. Survived by children, George, Jo Ann; 6 grands; 8 great-grands. Predeceased by husband, Joseph; daughter, Cathy.

BELAND, Donald P. 78, CPL, U.S. Army, Kprean War veteran, of St. Peteraburg, died March 17, 2011. For funeral information and to sign guestbook visit www.veteransfuneralcare.com

BELZER, Ester K. 89, of Brooksville, died March 19. She is survived by her children, Frank, Wayne, Madelyn, Montene, & Glynlea; and many other family members. Merritt Funeral Home - Spring Hill

BOSI, Kimberly Jimmie 49, of Clearwater, went to Heaven on March 17th, beloved daughter of Ruby Jimmie, Howard Jimmie and Sandra June. She leaves behind daughter Kristen; granddaughter Jessie; sisters, Laura and Tammy; nephew Chad; nieces Crystal and Shelby, and all of her other family and friends. Memorial services will be held Tuesday night, March 22nd, 7:30 pm at Pathways Community Church 801 Seminole Blvd, Largo.

BROWN, Harold S. died March 20. Chapel Service 11 am today. Burial will follow at Royal Palm Cemetery S. Guestbook @ davidcgross.com David C. Gross Funeral Homes 6366 Central Ave / 727-381-4911

BUTLER, John Dale 77, of Largo, died Sunday, March 20, 2011, at Palms of Pasadena Hospital. Born in Fostoria, OH, he came here in 1967 from Indianapolis, IN. He was a United States Army veteran having served during the Korean War in the 75th Regimental Combat Team. He was the former owner and operator of the Gold Coffee Shop in downtown St. Petersburg. He was a partner in the real estate firm, Butler-Brand, Inc, in St. Petersburg. After closing the real estate firm, he joined Gulf & Southern Mortgage Brokers. He was a Christian. He was an active member of Northside Lodge # 283 F&AM, the Scottish Rite and Egypt Temple Shrine. He was a Kentucky Colonel of Commonwealth of Kentucky. He was a member of the U.S. Junior Chamber of Commerce and the St. Petersburg Board of Realtors. He was preceded in death by his parents, Charles S. and Katherine M. Butler and his wife, Helen M. Butler. He is survived by his loving companion, Mary W. Brand of 35 years; his son and daughter-in-law, John D. II and MaryEllen Butler; his daughter and son-in-law, Tamara K. "Tammy" Cooper and John N. Gallant; and two grandsons, Charles Edward Mallette IV and Charles Steven Butler, all of St. Petersburg. There will be visitation from 5-8 pm on Thursday at Anderson-McQueen Funeral Home, 2201-Dr. M.L. King Street North, where a funeral service will be held at 10 am on Friday. Visit the family's personalized online Guestbook @ www.AndersonMcQueen.com Anderson-McQueen Funeral Home N.E. St. Petersburg Chapel 727- 822-2059

BUTTS, Fred L. Jr. Passed away on March 20, 2011 at the Mease Dunedin Hospital in Dunedin. Born in Southampton, NY to Fred and Margaret (Silvey) Butts on Aug. 8, 1938, he was 72 years old. He is survived by his wife Peggie (Lattanzio) and daughter Jean Benkoczy (Michael); grandchildren, Nicole & Michael Benkoczy; & two great-grandsons Austin and Max; and daughter Kellie Anderson and grandchildren Kaitlin, Josiah and Zachariah. All reside in Fort White, FL. He is also survived by his sister Patricia Zaykowski Stellmach, husband Tom, of Dunedin, George Butts of Shelter Island, NY; sister-in-law Jane Early of Columbus, OH and 8 nieces and nephews. After graduating from Pierson High School in Sag Harbor, NY in June of 1955, Fred joined the U.S. Navy, serving for four years. Upon leaving the service he rejoined his father in the family painting business in Sag Harbor for many years before becoming an elected official as an Assessor for East Hampton Town and became the Chairman of the Board of Assessors. He also was on the staff of the late Perry B. Duryea, Jr., former New York State Assemblyman and also served as a legislative aid to former supervisors, Joseph Caputo and John Klein of Suffolk County. After leaving politics he reopened his painting business for a number of years and retired in 1994 when he and his wife moved to Dunedin where they enjoyed playing golf, traveling and being near their children and grandchildren. Fred was a member of the American Legion in Sag Harbor and Dunedin, AmVet, the Sag Harbor Fire Dept., The Southampton Elks Club, the Elks Club of Dunedin and the Sag Harbor Golf Club. There will be a visitation at Curlew Hills Memorial Gardens on Tuesday, March 22, 2011 from 5-7 pm, followed by cremation. A memorial service will be held at a later time in Sag Harbor. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the Sag Harbor Fire Department, 1357 Bricklin Rd., Sag Harbor, NY, or the American Legion, 26 Bay St., Sag Harbor, NY 11963. www.curlewhills.com

CAMERON, Elaine L. 83, New Port Richey, died March 18. Retired fashion designer. Survived by sons, Robert (Deb), John; sister Diane; 6 grands. Burial in Carmel NY. Michels & Lundquist F.H.

CAMPBELL, Rosemary K. of the Mainlands, passed away Feb. 9, 2011. There will be a Celebration of Life Service at St. Bede's Episcopal Church, 2500 16th St. N., 12 noon, Saturday, March 26, 2011.

CASPER, Janet 74, passed away March 19, 2011. Services and burial will be in West Bend, WI. Guestbook at davidcgross.com David C. Gross Funeral Homes 6366 Central Ave / 727-381-4911

CHAPPORY, Sandra 68, Inverness, died March 11, 2011 at Hospice of Citrus County. Professional services entrusted to New Serenity Memorial Funeral Home & Cremation Svcs., Inc. 563-1394

COSS, Lee Ann 58, entered into rest March 17, 2011. She is survived by her beloved husband of 28 years, William "Bill"Coss; son, Robert Nyegard (Tobi); daughter, Michelle Hernandez (Alex); stepson, Michael Coss; five sisters; eight grandchildren and an extended loving family and friends. Lee Ann was very much loved and will be greatly missed by all who knew her. A funeral service will be held 3 pm with visitation two hours prior Thursday, March 24, 2011 at Hillsboro Memorial Funeral Home. Interment will immediately follow at Hillsboro Memorial Gardens. Hillsboro Memorial

DABROWSKI, Robert John 63, Largo, died March 19. Survived by daugher Cheryl; brothers Peter & Edward; and sister Carol Wright. RhodesFuneralDirectors.com 727-446-3055

DeMINT, Susan 62, of Spring Hill went home to be with her Lord on March 17, 2011. Susan is survived by her loving husband of 13 years, Don; sons, Kevin (Jessica) Musall, and Paul (Traci) Musall; 3 grand-children; father, Paul Walker; sisters Katherine Jacokes and Paula Cantu; brother Jerrold Walker. A memorial service will be held 2 pm Saturday March 26th at the Highlands Baptist Church in Weeki Wachee. In lieu of flowers, donations to Highlands Baptist Church.

DEMPSTER, Diana Jean 55, passed away March 21, 2011, after a long illness. She was born in Buffalo, NY, to Jean Van Osten Dempster and Richard Vreeland Dempster, her loving parents. Diana graduated from the University of La Verne, in California, and worked in the insurance industry for many years. She had been a Florida resident since 2004. She is survived by her father, and by her sisters, Denise Dempster Watkins, of Crystal Beach, and Donna Dempster Boggs of Walnut Creek, CA. No sweeter, kinder person ever lived. A memorial service will be held Thursday, March 24, at Curlew Hills Funeral Home at 6 pm with a reception to follow. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Suncoast Hospice, 5771 Roosevelt Blvd, Clearwater, FL 33760-9962 Curlew Hills Funeral Home

ERSKINE, Norma Jean 76, of Boothbay, ME, formerly of Largo, died March 16, 2011. She is survived by her loving family. Services will be held in the Spring in Boothbay, announced at a later date.

EWART, Thomas E. passed away Friday, March 18, 2011, at the age of 75. Predeceased by his brother, Robert W. Ewart; sister, Rosemary D. Ewart and cousin Thomas Koch. Tom is survived by his sister-in-law, Florence M. Ewart; nieces, Kathleen Ewart and Ellen (Joseph Cardella) Ewart; nephew, David (Katherine) Ewart; great-nieces, Katelyn and Lauren Ewart and Florence Cardella, and many dear friends. No prior visitation. Friends are invited to meet the family Wednesday, 9:30 am at Peace of Christ Parish at St. John the Evangelist Church, 553 Humbolt St., Rochester, NY for his funeral mass. Interment Holy Sepulchre Cemetery. To light a candle in Thomas's memory or to send the family a condolence, please visit www.harrisfuneralhome.com.

GEORGE, Morris Wayne 69, of Hudson, died March 16, 2011. He is survived by his wife, a daughrer, a son, a stepdaughter, a sister, and grandchildren. Abbey Affordable Cremation Largo 727-517-2340

GEORGEADES, Espa 82, died March 19. Viewing: March 23, 2-4 & 6-8 pm, 4450 U.S. 19. Mass: March 24, 10 am, St. George Greek Church, 9426 Little Road. Burial: Florida Nat'l. Brewer & Sons 596-4991

GOULD, Doris Jean 83, of St. Petersburg, died March 18, 2011. Survived by her daughter, Virginia French; 2 grandsons, Robert F. & Michael B. Abbey Affordable Cremation, Largo 727-517-2340

GOWER, Marvin 84, a Tampa native, passed away March 20, 2011. As a young man he served in the United States Navy. He was preceded in death by his wife, Gwendolyn in 2003. He is survived by his son, Dave Gower (Debbie); grandson, Lee Gower; brother, Walter Gower (Lynda); and an extended family and friends. A funeral service will take place at 10 am with a visitation one hour prior, Wednesday, March 23, 2011, at Stowers Funeral Home. Interment will follow in Myrtle Hill Memorial Park. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to HPH Hospice Foundation, 12107 Majestic Blvd., Hudson, FL 34667-2455, www.hph-hospice.org, 352-567-6837.

HUGHES, Joseph Patrick Joe passed away on the morning of Thursday March 17, 2011 at age 27, his passing was very unexpected. He was born Nov. 3, 1983 to Kelly Hughes of Safety Harbor. His life was dedicated to his family and friends. Joe lived life to the fullest, always with a ready smile and quick wit. He will continue to be loved by his mom, Kelly; brothers, Jason and Shawn; especially his nephew Michael and numerous aunts; uncles; cousins and friends.

HULVEY, Everett M. "Gizzle" 83, of St. Petersburg, went to be with the Lord on March 14, 2011. He was a retired contractor and served honorably in the U.S. Army. He will be remembered by family and friends as an avid fisherman who enjoyed bass fishing on Florida's lakes. He is survived by his loving wife and fishing partner, Phyllis Hulvey; children, Randy Hulvey and wife Nila, Judy Hulvey, Barbara Kries and husband Robert; and grandchildren, Zeric Hulvey and Robert Kries; and many more family members and friends. Gizzle will be truly missed by all.

JACOBS, Myra G. "Cissie" May 23, 1919 - Mar. 19, 2011 Predeceased by husband Bill in June, 1969. Survived by 3 children Edward; Linda & Susan; 3 grandchildren; and 7 great-grandchildren.

JOHNSON, Margaret S. 65, of Spring Hill, died March 20, 2011. She is survived by her children Anthony Finelli and Selina Palermo and many loving family. Merritt Funeral Home-Spring Hill

LANDIS, Victoria Anne 37, of New Port Richey, died March 19. Survived by mother, Valerie; daughter, Kathleen & 3 siblings. Service is private. Dobies F.H. Hudson dobiesfuneralhome.com

LANE, Edith "Sandy" 87, of Tampa, passed away on March 21, 2011. She is survived by 4 sons, Ronald Wilson Lane, Ralph Terrance Lane, David Saunders Lane, Michael Dudley Lane; a sister; 8 grandchildren and 10 great-grandchildren. She was a Presbyterian.

LANGMYER, Sharon K. Passed away March 20th, 2011. She is survived by her husband of 40 years, Donald; daughter, Kima Scott; sons, Donnie and Jason Langmyer; mother, Bernice Chambers; sisters, Genny Smith and Marsha Barnes; grandchildren, Tyler and Riley Scott, Logan and Chasen and Landen Langmyer. Friends will be received Thursday, March 24, from 3-5 pm at the funeral home with a service at 5 pm. R. Lee Williams & Son 49th St. 527-1177 www.rlwilliams.com

LECLAIR, Bonnie 81, of St. Petersburg, died Saturday, March 19, 2011, at Kindred Hospital. There are no known survivors. ALifeTribute-Gulfport

LeROY, Pansy L. 99, of Tampa, passed away March 18, 2011. Pansy was preceded in death by her husband of 57 years, Armando S. LeRoy who was 1st president of the Fun & Frolick unit of Egypt Temple Shrine. Her belief was "Everything works out according to God's plan." She was a faithful member of Hope Bible Church.She is survived by her sons Gene LeRoy & his wife Rita & Glenn LeRoy of Tampa; 3 grandchildren, Christopher Dean LeRoy, Shannon Glenn Hensley, Justin David Hay-LeRoy; 4 great-grandchildren, Jacob Hensley, Jessica Shannon LeRoy, Kyndal LeRoy, Jaiden LeRoy. A graveside service will be held Wednesday, March 23, 2011, at 11:30 am at the Garden of Memories in Tampa. Brewer & Sons Funeral Home 813-887-4991

L'HEUREUX, Horace A. "Frenchy" 97, of Spring Hill, died March 21. He is survived by daughters, Elizabeth Wyllie, Shirley Petre & Ethelene DiBona; 9 grandchildren; many great-grandchildren and many great-great-grand- children. A memorial service will be held 12 pm Monday, March 28, 2011 at Aripeka Elks #2520, 9135 Denton Ave., Hudson. Dobies F.H.-Hudson dobiesfuneralhome.com

LONG, Ronald Jr. 47, of Clearwater, passed away March 19, 2011. He is survived by his wife, Susan Fredericks; his mother, a brother and 3 sisters. Abbey Affordable Cremation 517-2340

LYNCH, Shirley M. 87, of Tarpon Springs, died March 2, 2011. Survived by daughter Terry Markham; son, Michael Lynch, family and friends.

MACRI, Kenneth C. 80, passed March 19, 2011. Survived by children, Kenneth, Joseph, Michael, Linda, Jean & Teresa, 3 grands, 1 great-grand. Downing Funeral Home

MERTZ, Grace B. 94, of Holiday, died March 21, 2011. Survived by daughter, Barbara Votta; sons, Otto, William & Kenneth and a loving family. Michels & Lundquist Funeral Home

MILLS, Jayne (nee Pfeiffer) 85, of Palm Harbor, passed away on Sunday, March 20, 2011. She is survived by her loving husband of 61 years, Leroy; 8 children; 13 grandchildren; brother, Tom (Marie); sisters-in-law, Rose and Erna (Ralph). A visitation will be held at Moss Feaster in Palm Harbor on Wednesday, March 23, from 5-8 pm followed by a Funeral Mass at St. Michael's Catholic Church in Clearwater on Thursday beginning at 10:30 am. In lieu of flowers, please make a donation to the Humane Society of Pinellas. www.mossfeasterpalmharbor.com

MONROE, Margaret 94, of New Port Richey, died Thursday, March 17, 2011 in Carrollwood, GA. North-Meadowlawn Funeral Home

MONTERO, Helen Jane "Lolly", 72, of New Port Richey, passed away March 19, 2011. She was a member of St. Thomas Aquinas Catholic Church, New Port Richey & is survived by two sons, Charles, New Port Richey & James, Holiday; four daughters, Kathy Griffin, Holly Johnson, Colleen O'Drain & Jean Bready, all of New Port Richey; 14 grandchildren & 7 great-grandchildren. She is preceded in death by a grandson, Kenneth Montero. Visitation Friday, 9:30-10:30 am at Michels & Lundquist Funeral Home, 5228 Trouble Creek Road, New Port Richey. A Funeral Mass will take place Friday, 11 am at St. Thomas Aquinas Catholic Church. Interment at Long Island National Cemetery, Amityville, NY.

MOSHER, William Joseph 64, of Dunedin, died March 19, 2011, at Bay Pines VA Medical Center under Hospice care. He is survived by his loving family and friends. Private services will be held.

NELSON, Geraldine Maude 86, of St. Petersburg, died Saturday, March 19, 2011, at Bayfront Medical Center. She is survived by a loving family. ALifeTribute-Gulfport

NIFORATOS, Eleftheria age 97, of New Port Richey, died Sunday, March 20, 2011. She was born in Greece. Survived by sons Angelo (Frances) and Thomas (Joyce); brothers Taxiarxis (Sylvia) and Aristotle Niforatos; her daughter-in-law Laura Niforatos; 10 grandchildren and 24 great-grandchildren. The family will receive friends Tuesday, March 22, from 47 pm at Sylvan Abbey Funeral Home, 2853 Sunset Point Road Clearwater 727-796-1992. Services will be Wednesday, March 23, at 10 am at St. George Creek Orthodox Church 9426 Little Road NPR. Entombment to follow in Sylvan Abbey Memorial Park.

PALOMINO, Daniel "Danny" 65, of Clearwater, passed away Sunday March 20, 2011. For information, contact Sylvan Abbey Funeral Home 727-796-1991 SylvanAbbey.com

PANTHER, Edward "Ed" 74, died March 17. Survived by his loving wife, Rosalyn; 2 sons, Gregory and Matthew; 4 sisters, Lynne, Bonnie, Jane and Robyn. NCS Clearwater 727-536-0494

PAPALE, Theresa 57, of Masaryktown, died March 18. Survived by 2 daughters; 1 stepson; 5 grands; mother; 5 brothers; 4 sisters; Brewer & Sons 352-796-4991

PATNAUDE, Todd Michael Joined his sister Elizabeth March 10, 2011. He leaves behind his parents, Dian and Dennis Jones; a brother, Chris Jones; and his daughter, Hannah Lord. Will be missed.

PILGRIM, Leslie E. 62, of St. Petersburg, died March 1. Mass from St. Mary Our Lady of Grace April 1, at 10 am with interment at Bay Pines National at 2:15 pm. www.veteransfuneralcare.com

RAMSDELL, Arthur John Age 87, died on March 20, 2011. He was born in Queens, NY, the son of Arthur and Margaret Lawlor Ramsdell, who predeceased him. He was a combat veteran of World War II and served in Italy with the 10th Mountain Division. He was a graduate of Pace University and was one of the original employees of the United Nations. He retired after 36 years of service, as Chief of Energy Statistics in the Department of Economic Affairs. Arthur was an avid golfer and a member of the East Lake Woodlands Country Club. He was a member of the Board of Directors of Quail Forest Homeowner's Association. Arthur was a Eucharistic Minister at St. Ignatius of Antioch Catholic Church in Tarpon Springs. Arthur was the loving husband of Dorothy for over 64 years, the loving father of two sons, Robert (Nancy), a Vietnam veteran, who pre-deceased him and Brian (Cindy) of Vancouver, WA. He had a sister, Ruth Murphy from Spotswood, NJ; four grandchildren and four great-grandchildren. Visitation at Dobies Funeral Home in Tarpon Springs on Wednesday 2-4 pm and 6-8 pm. Mass of Resurrection at St. Ignatius of Antioch, Tarpon Springs on Thursday at 11 am. Burial Florida National with honors. In lieu of flowers, the family requests any gifts of love be sent to Suncoast Hospice, Brookside, 164 West Lake Rd., Palm Harbor, FL 34684. dobiesfuneralhome.com 727-942-0515

RATLIFF, Bethel 80, of Valrico passed away Friday, March 18, 2011. She is survived by her children, Michael Ratliff and Brenda Stempson; brothers, Paul and Al Hypes; a sister, Mary Faulkner; and three grandchildren. Affinity Cremation

ROSZELL, Doris F. "Doe" 84, of Tarpon Springs, died March 18. Survived by daughters, Dale (Jim) McDonald, Devon (Scott) Goyer; grands Gracyn, & Danielle Goyer. Dobies FH-Tarpon

SCHMIDT, William S. 88, of St. Petersburg, died March 13, 2011. Survived by her loving family. Holloway Funeral Home, Inc. Oldsmar 813-855-2439

SERVIN, Audrey V. 91, of Spring Hill, died Mar. 18, 2011. Survived by husband Edward; 3 children; 2 stepchildren; 6 grands; 3 great-grands. NCS&BS Hudson, 727-847-4745

SHERWOOD, Marvin 87, of New Port Richey, and longtime resident of Colony Cove, died March 18. He was a U.S. Army veteran of WWII and recipient of the Bronze Star. He is survived by his wife, Gladys; sons, Gary Tarzell, Dennis Sherwood; daughters, Joyce Fabian, Bonnie Kingsley; 11 grand-children; 1 great-grandchild. A memorial Mass will be held at Our Lady Queen of Peace Catholic Church on Thursday, March 24, at 10 am. Luncheon to follow at Colony Cove Clubhouse. Morgan Funeral Home. 727-847-3999

SMITH, Fred Harry 69, of Maderia Beach, passed away Thursday, March 17, 2011 at his residence. There are no known survivors. ALife Tribute FuneralCare Largo 727-559-7793

SMITH, Patricia Ann Scheu Pat died peacefully at her home in Madeira Beach on Saturday March 19, 2011 at the age of 79. At the time of her death, Pat's living relatives were her husband of 56 years, Gregory B. Smith; her daughter, Laura Marie Stewart and husband, Chris, their children, David and Brendan of Chapel Hill, NC; her son, Edward Smith and wife, Teresa and their children, Jennifer, Gordon, Michael and Kristin of Riverview; sisters, Margaret Marcon and husband, Bill; Nancy Czakany; Jane Prescott and husband, Fred; and many beloved nieces and nephews. Her deceased relatives include her son, David Andrew Smith; sister, Barbara Eleftheriou; and brothers, Andrew and George Scheu. Pat was born on March 3, 1932 in New York City, the daughter of Andrew and Elizabeth Fields Scheu. She attended St. Joan of Arc Elementary School, St. Agnes High School, Brooklyn Hospital School of Nursing, and Hunter College in New York. Pat was a registered nurse in New York and after moving to North Carolina in 1973 worked as a paramedic, a position she truly loved. Her experiences with the ambulance service led her to a 23-year teaching career in the Emergency Medical Science program at Greensboro Technical Community College. Pat was a lifelong devout Catholic with an unfailing devotion to the Lord. Her life exemplified the Beatitudes as was evidenced by her active participation in numerous ministries at St. Paul the Apostle Catholic Church in Greensboro, NC. Pat had a diaconal heart and a love of life, always serving her family, her parish community, her students and the community at large, consistently putting others before herself. Throughout her life Pat was an inspiration to all she met and freely gave her time, talent and treasure, but above all she provided guidance and unconditional love to all she encountered. A memorial Mass will be offered at St. Paul's Church in Greensboro, NC in May at a date to be determined. In lieu of flowers, donations in Pat's honor may be made to Suncoast Hospice of St. Petersburg, Florida or to St. Paul the Apostle Catholic Church in Greensboro, NC. Mohn Funeral Home-Seminole

TIRRELL, Elise B. 85, a long time Pinellas Park resident, went home to be with the Lord on March 20, 2011. She was an active member of Allendale UMC and sang in the choir. She was preceded in death by her husband, Ted in 1992. She is survived by 3 sons; 2 daughters-in-law; 4 grandchildren; and 3 great-grand- children. All services will be held at Memorial Park Funeral Home. Viewing will be 1-2 pm with service to follow at 2 pm on March 22, 2011. In lieu of flowers, please donate to Suncoast Hospice. Memorial Park Funeral Home. 727-527-1196

WALTERS, Frances Paff 76, passed into the light March 17, 2011. Born in Brooklyn, NY, she lived here since 1953. She brought elegance & class to every moment. Her love & influence will be reflected in us forever. Survivors are her 3 children Clyde J. Walters Jr., Patti Oriot, & Rhonda Walters; 6 grandchildren; 6 great-grandchildren, & all who loved her. A Celebration of Her Life is Wed., March 23 at 6 pm. Call 727-688-9453 for details. Donations may be made to Children's Cancer Center. Leave a tribute at: www.forevermissed.com

WEYMOUTH, Alveretta Mae 89, seasonal resident of Palm Harbor, passed away March 19, 2011. She is survived by her loving family. Holloway Funeral Home Inc. Oldsmar 813-855-2439

WHITE, John 87, of Asheville, NC., formerly of Clearwater and Norwood, MA, died on March 16, 2011. Beloved husband of Rashedy "Ricky" (Maloof) White. Devoted father of John "Jay" C. White III. of Palmyra, ME, and Leslie (White) Bradshaw of Swannanoa, NC; brother of Frank White of Brookton, ME. Also survived by 5 grandchildren; and 1 great-grandchild. Arrangements under the direction of the Kraw-Kornack Funeral Home 1248 Washington St. Norwood Ma. 02062. Burial will take place at a later date. WWII US Navy CB's Veteran. Former member of Norwood VFW. www.kraw- kornackfuneralhome.com 781-762-0482

WHITLEY, Denise Corey 49, of Largo, died Friday, March 18, 2011, at Moffitt Cancer Center. She is predeceased by her father, Walter Corey and her husband Roy Whitley. She is survived by her mother Geraldine Corey of Largo; her sister Pat (Bob) Lancaster of Seminole; her brother Joseph Corey of Boca Raton; nieces and nephews Chris (Katie), Bobby (Flannery), Matt, Richie, Mary, AJ, and Cari; many awesome friends at Oakhurst Veterinary Clinic and her dog and best pal, Belle. Reese Funeral Home 391-9954

WISNER, John Morse 91, passed away peacefully at home on March 12, 2011. He was born in New York City and had lived in Tampa for 60 years. He held an Electrical Engineering degree from NYC College and traveled throughout Florida during his career. He was a brilliant man who enjoyed computers and had a life long habit of reading at least a book a day. John was a body builder in his youth and met his wife of 65 years while serving in the U.S. Air Force in Hawaii during WWII. John is survived by his wife, Lavonia Wisner; daughters, Linda Sanford of San Diego, CA, Patricia Cain of Tampa; a son, Capt. James Wisner of Tampa; grandchildren, Briggs (Beau) and Crystal Cain; nephew, James DeRosa of Northvale, NJ. A private family gathering will be held following cremation. Gifts of remembrance may be made to Alzheimer's Assn. or Tampa Public Library. Brewer & Sons Funeral Home 813-835-4991

WOODY, Andrew T. 85, of Hudson, died March 20, 2011. Born in Key West, he was a mail carrier for 32 years. He moved to Hudson in 1977. Lifetime member of NALC with 60 plus years in the union and honorary member of Gulf Highlands Civic Assoc. Survived by daughter, Susan (Scott) Perlowski and granddaughters, Jessica and Jamie. Visitation Thursday, March 24, 5 pm until the service starts at 7 pm. Dobies Funeral Home-Hudson 727-868-4441 dobiesfuneralhome.com

WYNN, Beatrice 76, died March 21, 2011 died at Hospice House Woodside. No known survivors. ALifeTribute Funeral Care. 727-559-7793.
